article:
'[http://www.local.org/aggregat.html Community Choice Aggregation]' or 'CCA' is
a system ( neither a company nor an organization) adopted into law in the states
of Massachusetts, Ohio, California, New Jersey and Rhode Island which allows
cities and counties to aggregate the buying power of individual customers within
a defined jurisdiction in order to secure alternative energy supply contracts.
Currently, nearly one million Americans receive service from CCAs.
